snippet: No one expects Aleksei A. Navalny to win the mayoral election in Moscow, but as the anti-Putin candidate who was released from prison for the campaign, he is a critical part of the equation.
abstract: Aleksei A Navalny, Russian opposition figure who is running as longshot candidate in Moscow's mayoral race, is seeking to garner enough votes to force runoff with Sergei S Sobyanin, who was endorsed by Vladimir V Putin; Navalny was unexpectedly released from five-year embezzlement sentence after authorities decided his participation was needed to ensure fair election.

byline.original: By DAVID M. HERSZENHORN and ANDREW ROTH

lead_paragraph: No one expects Aleksei A. Navalny to win the mayoral election in Moscow, but as the anti-Putin candidate who was released from prison for the campaign, he is a critical part of the equation.

headline.main: In Moscow Mayoral Race, an Important Nonfavorite
headline.print_headline: In Moscow Mayoral Race, An Important Nonfavorite
